metadata.title: CVE-2023-37577 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple use-after-free vulnerabilities exist in the VCD get_vartokenrealloc functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .vcd file canlead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a maliciousfile to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns theuse-after-free when triggered via the vcd2lxt2 conversion utility.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
